All Implemented Interfaces:
BlockTaglet, SimpleTaglet
public class DefinitionListBlockTaglet
extends TextFilterBlockTaglet

Block taglet that outputs its texts in form of a definition list.

Method Detail

initialize

public void initialize(String cssClass,
                       String header,
                       boolean multiheader)
Sets the CSS stylesheet class of the definition list as well as the header to use.

Parameters:
cssClass - the CSS stylesheet class of the <dl>.
header - the header to use.
multiheader - indicates if the header is printed multiple times (true) or only once (false).
Since:
1.3.0

getHeader

public String getHeader()
Returns the definition list header.

Note:

If no header has been set the taglet will use the capitalized taglet name in boldface as header (to mock the default JavaDoc behavior).

Returns:
the definition list header.
Since:
1.3.0

getCssClass

public String getCssClass()
Returns the CSS class of the definition list.

Returns:
the CSS class of the definition list or an empty string if no class has been specified.
Since:
1.3.0

configure

public void configure(Logger logger,
                      Configuration configuration)
Configures this definition list block taglet.

The following configuration paramters are recognized:

"dl.class"
The <dl> CSS class used in the output. Defaults to no CSS class.
"dl.header"
The header used for <dt>. Defaults to the capitalized, tag name in boldface.
"dl.multiheader"
Indicates if the header is repeated for each tag occurence (true) or if the header is only printed once (false). Defaults to false.

Specified by:
configure in interface SimpleTaglet
Overrides:
configure in class TextFilterTaglet
Parameters:
logger - the logger to use for message output during configuration.
configuration - the taglets configuration to use for configuration.
Since:
1.3.0

getOutput

public String getOutput(Logger logger,
                        Parameter parameter,
                        String[] texts)
Description copied from interface: BlockTaglet
Returns the output for the specified input texts.

The input texts are fully resolved, i.e. if they contain further inline tags they are first resolved before being passed to this method.

For each block tag that appears in the documentation a separate input text is created. Once all input texts for a given section of the documentation have been collected they are passed in to this method.

Specified by:
getOutput in interface BlockTaglet
Overrides:
getOutput in class TextFilterBlockTaglet
Implementation Notes:
Returns the texts in form of a definition list.
Parameters:
logger - the logger to use for emiting messages.
parameter - the parameter for the tag currently processed.
texts - the fully resolved tag texts.
Returns:
the output text to use in the documentation.
Since:
1.3.0
